com.esri.mo2.map.prj
Interface UserCredentialsHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseUserCredentialsHandler
public interface UserCredentialsHandler

Defines an interactive way of processing of a MO Java configuration file with a restricted ArcIMS map service, which needs a user name and a password to be entered.

Here is an example of using the methods of the interface to process an ArcIIMS image service:
      //precondition: import com.esri.mo2.client.aims.ImageServer;
      //precondition: UserCredentialsHandler uHandler;
      //precondition: import com.esri.mo2.client.io.AuthenticationRequiredException;       //precondition: import com.esri.mo2.client.io.AuthenticationFailedException;       int numberTrys = 0;
      while ( numberTrys < 3) {
      try {
      return ImageServer.getLayerSource(service);
      } catch (AuthenticationRequiredException ex) {
      if( uHandler.askCredentials(ex)) {
      service.setUsername(uHandler.getUserName());
      service.setPassword(uHandler.getPassword());
      }
      else //*> authentification process is canceled by user
      throw new AuthenticationFailedException(ex.getServiceProxy(),ex.getRealm(),ex.getUsername(),ex.getPassword());
      //<*
      } catch (AuthenticationFailedException ex) {
      if( uHandler.showErrorAndAskAgain(ex)) {
      service.setUsername(uHandler.getUserName());
      service.setPassword(uHandler.getPassword());
      }
      else //*> authentification process is canceled by user
      throw ex;
      //<*
      }
      numberTrys++;
      }
      //<-

Method Summary
 boolean askCredentials(AuthenticationRequiredException ex)
          Asks user credentials.
 String getPassword()
          Obtains a password from a user credentials dialog
 String getUserName()
          Obtains a user name from a user credentials dialog
 boolean showErrorAndAskAgain(AuthenticationFailedException ex)
          Permits to show a user credentials dialog again, if previous user try was failed.
 

Method Detail

askCredentials

public boolean askCredentials(AuthenticationRequiredException ex)
Asks user credentials. It can be implemented as a popup dialog.

Parameters:
ex -
Returns:
true - if user entered a user name and/or password,
false - if user pushed CANCEL button

getUserName

public String getUserName()
Obtains a user name from a user credentials dialog

Returns:
user name as a string

getPassword

public String getPassword()
Obtains a password from a user credentials dialog

Returns:
password as a string

showErrorAndAskAgain

public boolean showErrorAndAskAgain(AuthenticationFailedException ex)
Permits to show a user credentials dialog again, if previous user try was failed.

Parameters:
ex -
Returns:
true - if user entered a user name and/or password,
false - if user pushed CANCEL button
